name: Air Fryer Old Bay® Chicken Wings
author: Yoly
summary: Old Bay® is a seasoning most people think is for seafood. But it's also a great seasoning for poultry. These wings are crispy and lower in calories because they are air fried and tasty thanks to the addition of Old Bay® seasoning.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
¼ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper
1 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
directions: Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Place chicken wings in a large bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons  ® seasoning and black pepper
Add cornstarch and toss wings until fully coated
Shake each wing and place in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching; cook in batches if necessary
Fry in the preheated air fryer for 10 minutes, shake the basket, and fry an additional 8 minutes
Flip wings over and fry until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear, 5 to 6 more minutes
Meanwhile, combine butter and 1 teaspoon Old Bay® seasoning for sauce in a small saucepan
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly
Dip each wing in the sauce
Serve with remaining sauce on the side
